roleset.name: provide proof for, proven/proving
roleset.note: EVIDENCE-V NOTES: Target of the trace is the act of "remaining there", which cannot beselected without including the trace itself. Bummer. I don't think this can ever appear in the active. (from evidence.01-v)
EVIDENT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on medi-tmprl1to8. (from evident.01-j)

example.name: as evidenced
example.text: The use of [the abominable construction practices in the Soviet Union]-1 -- as *trace*-1 evidenced *trace*-1 by the collapse of sand apartment blocks during the Armenian earthquake -- as a metaphor for the U.S. economic system was a sublime example of Mr. Cockburn's satirical muse.
example.arg: by the collapse of sand apartment blocks during the Armenian earthquake

example.name: untraceable
example.text: And it has remained there, as *trace*-1 evidenced *trace*-1 by its reappearance in a 1972 CBS sitcom called ``Bridget Loves Bernie,'' whose sole distinction was that it led to the real-life marriage of Meredith Baxter and David Birney.
example.arg: by its reappearance in a 1972 CBS sitcom called ``Bridget Loves Bernie,'' whose sole distinction was that it led to the real-life marriage of Meredith Baxter and David Birney

example.name: more obviously verbal
example.text: [Sluggish demand]-1 was also evidenced *trace*-1 by the weak 2.41-to-1 bid-to-cover ratio, which was lower than the average 2.79-to-1 ratio at the last 12 similar auctions.
example.arg: by the weak 2.41-to-1 bid-to-cover ratio, which was lower than the average 2.79-to-1 ratio at the last 12 similar auctions

example.name: Adjective usage: evident
example.text: This was evident from his confusion and embarrassment in reading the minutes.
example.arg: from his confusion and embarrassment in reading the minutes.
